segments.en: Linked Discourses 22
7. The Perfected Ones
66. Impermanence
At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu … pe … ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha … and asked him,

segments.pli: “sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṅkhittena dhammaṃ desetu … pe … ātāpī pahitatto vihareyyan”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”

segments.pli: “Yaṃ kho, bhikkhu, aniccaṃ; tatra te chando pahātabbo”ti.
segments.en: “Mendicant, give up desire for anything that’s impermanent.”
“Understood, Blessed One! Understood, Holy One!”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, bhikkhu, mayā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāsī”ti?
segments.en: “But how do you see the detailed meaning of my brief statement?”

segments.pli: “Rūpaṃ kho, bhante, aniccaṃ; tatra me chando pahātabbo.
segments.en: “Sir, form is impermanent; I should give up desire for it.
Feeling …
Perception …
Choices …

segments.pli: viññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ; tatra me chando pahātabbo.
segments.en: Consciousness is impermanent; I should give up desire for it.

segments.pli: Imassa khvāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṃ vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāmī”ti.
segments.en: That’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”
“Good, good, mendicant!

segments.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṃ, bhikkhu, mayā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāsi.
segments.en: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of what I’ve said in brief like this.

segments.pli: Rūpaṃ kho, bhikkhu, aniccaṃ; tatra te chando pahātabbo.
segments.en: Form is impermanent; you should give up desire for it.
Feeling …
Perception …
Choices …

segments.pli: viññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ; tatra kho te chando pahātabbo.
segments.en: Consciousness is impermanent; you should give up desire for it.

segments.pli: Imassa kho, bhikkhu, mayā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo”ti … pe …
segments.en: This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what I said in brief.” …

segments.pli: aññataro ca pana so bhikkhu arahataṃ ahosīti.
segments.en: And that mendicant became one of the perfected.

suttaplex.blurb: One should let go of desire for what is impermanent, namely the five aggregates.
